item.title: A nifty window layout switcher for macOS using Hammerspoon
item.description: I’m a sucker for screen real estate, and thus I use 2 32" 4k monitors so I can see most of my apps’ windows simultaneously, instead of switching back and forth between them. #myworkplace is pretty lean (on cables) and mean (on screen real estate). And a lot of tileception goes on (window tiling, then local tmux tiling, then 1-2 levels of remote tmux tiling) pic.twitter.com/wCqsusBfRb — Shantanu Goel (@shantanugoel) August 10, 2020 I use the awesome Rectangle app that provides shortcuts to move/resize an app window to my liking.

item.title: Automatic notes backup on macOS with hammerspoon
item.description: I’m a backup nerd and like to back-up everything I do. Not just that, I like to version them too so I can go back in time to any point. git serves as a good tool for me for versioning wherever small data/text files etc are concerned and then I back this up with remote git servers like my own git server on a raspberry pi at home, a gitlab server and a github server.
